reviews.text: I stayed here over the Christmas period with my family, having stayed here twice before and have always been very pleased with the hotel, but not this time as I felt that standards had really dropped in almost every department. The front desk staff were excellent as ever, as were the breakfast staff, but that was about it. A lot of the inventory in the kitchen area was missing, there was no way that you would have been able to have cooked a decent meal with what was available, luckily we always eat out at night so it caused us no problems. The bathroom was never cleaned once during our stay, there was not even a brush to enable us to clean the loo ourselves, the bedding was also never changed during our stay. Speaking to other guests on the ski bus en-route to Marmot Basin they were also encountering the same problems so it was not an isolated incident, yes they were busy but that is no excuse for poor service of the basics you expect in a hotel. We only ate in the restaurant once and that was once too often, dreadful food and it used to be so good, what has happened here, I can only think that they have changed the chef. No atmosphere in the bar either, probably down to the miserable git behind the bar, I could not get over how unpolite he was, what a difference to the previous barman.
reviews.title: Standards Have Slipped
very nice!
reviews.text: So to sum up, I was very disapointed about the Jasper Inn, it used to be so good but standards have slipped very badly. It is in an excellent location, being only a few minutes walk into the main town and no road noise, just get the houscleaning services and restaurant back up to the previous high standard and this hotel can be turned around, if not then it is only going to go one way and that is down.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a 3 nights there recently and it was great! From the time that we checked in, to the time that we checked out...we were treated VERY good. There was 4 rooms that we had booked and everyone had a great stay! The best thing for us, that they allowed dogs. Now, we were expecting a 'dog' unit to be stinky and stained carpet, etc. But you would NEVER be able to tell that it was a pet unit. It was great!!!! The only thing that kinda made me upset is that they KNEW that we had 2 dogs with us and that we needed a room that was ground unit and the dogs could be let out from the patio doors. Our room, had a HUGE drop over the patio door. We actually couldn't use it after all so we had to walk our dog all of the time (which was good for him!) but at times at night you don't feel like going out on a walk. So if you are brining a pet with you, ensure you get a room thats flat to the ground. Anyhow, no biggie and we didn't even complain so yeah. The kitchen units were WONDERFUL! We stayed in a one bedroom. The pool area was WONDERFUL and we only ate once at the restaurant as it was expensive and not our kind of food. However, we cooked the food we bought and on that note, I HIGHLY suggest going to the Super A as oppsed to the IGA as the prices are BRUTAL~
reviews.title: Cosy Room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyhow, we will FORSURE stay there again!
reviews.title: Better than it looks!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read other reviews of this hotel before booking it and I was pretty pleased with the result. We'd driven up to Jasper from Kamloops and found the check in staff to be courteous and helpful. We'd been upgraded to a duplex with a bedroom on another floor and 1 bedroom on the ground floor. We had a very clean kitchenette and a cosy sofa with a big fireplace. My only criticism would be, that it would have been great if the hotel had supplied logs to put on the fire. The parking is free and only a short walk into Jasper. No road noise as the hotel is set 1 street back from the main road. A good hotel for a stopover!
reviews.title: Much better than it initially looks

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights during a 3 week holiday with my husband and my parents. On arrival we were luckily to be told that they had given us an upgrade and so instead of our 2 rooms we were upgraded to a 3 bedroom house across the road. This was in very good condition and had 2 ensuites and a further bedroom and bathroom downstairs.
reviews.title: loved Jasper

reviews.text: There was plenty of parking when we were here and it was bonus to have free parking. There was also free internet in the reception. The reception staff were very helpful during our stay here. We did go to the restaurant for our evening meal on the first night and enjoyed it so much we went there the second night!The buffalo and vension meatloaf was delicious.
reviews.title: Like having your own flat for a vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the shops and if are like us you may see elk wondering into town. The black sheep does a good cooked breakfast in the mornings if you don't want to have it in the hotel.
reviews.title: Gave bad impression
Very quaint
reviews.text: We only had an overnight stay at this Motel/Lodge but what a very pleasant experience, lounge area , Kitchen with full utensils and cooking facilities and three single beds aloft. Open fire for the cold winter nights this was picture postcard stuff. The dining room and breakfast was good value and plenty of choice. The Tea could have done being with hotter water but otherwise all ok. We visited as part of a Travelscope 9 day tripand would like to have had 2 nights here and not had to stay at Quesnel!!.

We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. I booked for my family the Loft room because I did not want to books their one bedroom Suite that are 'Pet Friendly'. We do not have a pet and therefore prefer a room that was not previously occupied by a dog.
reviews.title: Had a nice stay

likes.liked: — Easy to get around. Right in Jasper.

reviews.text: The Loft was nice. The actual bed is in the Loft. The fold out sofa bed for the kids is down below by the kitchen. The room also had a nice balcony overlooking the Interior gardens.
reviews.title: Dated but would definately visit again!

likes.liked: — Location, free Internet and great staff service

reviews.text: I was disappointed with the room. I booked the loft, but that doesn't work too well when the hotel has no air conditioning and you are sizzling upstairs in the heat! At least the hotel supplied a small fan.
reviews.title: Nothing Special

reviews.text: For what you pay for the room, you would expect something a little nicer. The room had the feel of a (very) budget motel chain and certainly not worth what you paid. It was clean and in a nice quiet location in Jasper, but you would have hoped for more.
reviews.title: A bit of both!!
Excellent hotel.... faultless!
reviews.text: That said, I am sure you could probably do worse while staying in Jasper, so read carefully all of the options before you book!
Booked a 'Last Minute Deal' so we were allocation on arrival, so did'nt read the reviews til we returned home...and they are so mixed. I agree with a bit of both good and bad.
reviews.title: Smoked out! Poor ventillation

likes.disliked: — Smoky rooms due to wood fireplaces and poor ventillation

reviews.text: Check in was excellent quick and easy which was as well after 9 and a half hours on the plane and 5 and a half hours on a bus.
reviews.title: Overrated unfortunately.
